---
title: "import_v1_1.json"
---

## High-level description
This JSON file represents a configuration for feature flags and user segments in a feature management system. It defines two feature flags with different types and configurations, as well as a user segment with specific matching criteria.

## Code Structure
The JSON structure consists of three main sections: `version`, `flags`, and `segments`. The `flags` array contains individual feature flag configurations, while the `segments` array defines user segments for targeting.

## Symbols

### Root Object
#### Description
The root object of the JSON file contains the version information and arrays for flags and segments.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| version | string | The version of the configuration format |
| flags | array | An array of feature flag configurations |
| segments | array | An array of user segment definitions |

### Flag Object
#### Description
Represents a single feature flag configuration with its properties and rules.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| key | string | Unique identifier for the flag |
| name | string | Display name of the flag |
| type | string | Type of the flag (e.g., "VARIANT_FLAG_TYPE", "BOOLEAN_FLAG_TYPE") |
| description | string | Description of the flag's purpose |
| enabled | boolean | Whether the flag is globally enabled or disabled |
| variants | array | (Optional) Array of variant configurations for variant flags |
| rules | array | (Optional) Array of targeting rules for variant flags |
| rollouts | array | (Optional) Array of rollout configurations for boolean flags |

### Variant Object
#### Description
Defines a variant option for a variant flag.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| key | string | Unique identifier for the variant |
| name | string | Display name of the variant |
| description | string | Description of the variant |
| attachment | object | (Optional) Additional data associated with the variant |

### Rule Object
#### Description
Defines a targeting rule for a variant flag.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| segment | string | The key of the segment to target |
| rank | number | The priority of the rule |
| distributions | array | Array of distribution configurations for variants |

### Rollout Object
#### Description
Defines a rollout configuration for a boolean flag.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| description | string | Description of the rollout |
| segment | object | (Optional) Segment-based rollout configuration |
| threshold | object | (Optional) Percentage-based rollout configuration |

### Segment Object
#### Description
Defines a user segment with matching criteria.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| key | string | Unique identifier for the segment |
| name | string | Display name of the segment |
| match_type | string | Type of matching to apply (e.g., "ANY_MATCH_TYPE") |
| description | string | Description of the segment's purpose |
| constraints | array | Array of constraint objects defining the segment criteria |

### Constraint Object
#### Description
Defines a single constraint for a user segment.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| type | string | Type of comparison (e.g., "STRING_COMPARISON_TYPE") |
| property | string | The user property to evaluate |
| operator | string | The comparison operator (e.g., "neq") |
| value | string | The value to compare against |

## Dependencies
This JSON file does not have any external dependencies. It is a self-contained configuration file.

## Configuration
The file itself serves as a configuration for a feature management system. It defines the following main configuration options:

| Option | Type | Description |
|:-------|:-----|:------------|
| version | string | Specifies the version of the configuration format (1.1 in this case) |
| flags | array | Defines the feature flags and their configurations |
| segments | array | Defines the user segments for targeting |

Each flag and segment has its own set of configuration options as described in the Symbols section.
